task.title: Locate a customized report
task.shortdesc: Strategies describing how to locate a customized report.

context.p: Sometimes a specific report is recommended by Customer Care to assist in retrieving data you are looking for. If your organization has customized the report suite's menu structure, sometimes these reports can be difficult to locate.

ul.li: Use the report search in version 15.

Toggle your account to use default menu structure. Using Report Settings, you can set your login to view all left hand menus based on default menu structure. After you find the specific report, disable this option to restore the customized menu for your account.

Use the Customize Menu feature to locate your report. Selecting a report within the interactive menu shows the name, default name, type (folder or link), and its visibility status. It is possible to locate any report by searching for its default menu name. This is the most comprehensive way, as it will also show you reports that have been hidden.

Contact a Supported User within your organization. If you have exhausted all other resources in locating the specific report, you can contact one of your organization's supported users. If they are not able to help, they can create a ticket to request Customer Care's assistance.
